VIII.iv.4.A.8.f
.
Importance of Reasoning in Awarding SMC Under 38 U.S.C 1114(l) When Considering Entitlement to A&A Under 38 U.S.C. 1114(o)
Make determinations of entitlement to SMC under
38 U.S.C. 1114(l)
on the basis of need of regular A&A in light of the criteria contained in
38 CFR 3.352(a)
.  Fully explain the reasoning in the
Narrative
of the rating decision.
Notes
:
The need to explain the reasoning is especially important in situations in which, under
38 CFR 3.350(c)
, the rate under
38 U.S.C. 1114(l)
based on the need for A&A is to be used as one of the conditions that entitles the claimant to two or more of the rates (no condition being considered twice) that are provided in
38 U.S.C. 1114(l) through (n)
for the purpose of establishing entitlement under
38 U.S.C. 1114(o)
.
Base the determination of need for A&A on separate and distinct disabilities if the rate under
38 U.S.C. 1114(l)
on account of need for A&A is used to establish entitlement under
38 U.S.C. 1114(o)
.
Example
:  If a Veteran has LOU of both feet and is also being considered for the maximum rate under
38 U.S.C. 1114(o)
because of the need for A&A, the need for A&A must be due to SC disabilities, completely independent of the LOU of both feet.  When determining whether the Veteran needs A&A, disregard the disabling effects of the LOU of both feet.  Show the need for A&A as due to a separate SC disability evaluated as 100-percent disabling.
